definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)
to live off a rich man

sentences.english: Financial tycoons are notorious for their exorbitant salaries.
sentences.chinese: 金融大款們就是牛在高薪。

sentences.english: He wants to all it Tycoon Tim.
sentences.chinese: 他想把它叫做“大款蒂姆”。

sentences.english: On the way back in the audition, just hit the ice to big style waterfront.
sentences.chinese: 在試鏡回來的路上，正好碰着傍到大款的冰。

sentences.english: Proud as these two moneybags are, they are afraid to see me.
sentences.chinese: 儘管兩個大款很高傲，他們都害怕來見我。

sentences.english: To prevent female college students "sits near the big style" phenomenon guangdong education for women.
sentences.chinese: 爲防止女大學生“傍大款”現象廣東試行女性教育。

sentences.english: Rich gays had put up big houses.
sentences.chinese: 有錢的同性戀大款蓋起了豪宅。

sentences.english: A well patinated, and large, carved hardwood figure of an elephant made in China, probably for export, during the 19th Century.
sentences.chinese: 極具年代陳積的大款硬木雕象，估爲19世紀外銷品。

sentences.english: Street corner is little mix mix He Bei, it is an anxiety of big money father.
sentences.chinese: 街頭小混混何北，是大款父親的一塊心病。

sentences.english: He wants to call it Tycoon Tim.
sentences.chinese: 他想把它叫做“大款蒂姆”。

sentences.english: I felt like a million bucks in it.
sentences.chinese: 我感覺穿着它就像個大款。

sentences.english: Everyone knows that his father is a moneybags.
sentences.chinese: 大家都知道他父親是個大款。

definition: "Mr Perfect" (i.e. tall, rich and handsome) (Internet slang)
children of entrepreneurs who became wealthy under Deng Xiaoping's economic reforms in the 1980s/see also 窮二代|穷二代[qiong2 er4 dai4]
"Ms Perfect" (i.e. fair-skinned, rich and beautiful) (Internet slang)

to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
